Message.Title: Monday's Low signalled a bottom.
Message.Msg: Could get a nice run to $13 from these levels. Looks like Monday's low is the bottom for the rest of this year. Expect a strong outlook for Tegra 3 and discrete graphics and Macs.

Topic.Title: Break out the Purplesaurus Rex boys, she's up a penny.

Message.Msg: crash the fed wire system eh? you sound incredibly young and dumb, son.

In excerpts -- I get to my point later. "Windows RT is... under-functional (you cannot install a single app that's not available through the Windows RT app store, which offers a paltry selection). This is nothing more than Microsoft's tablet... whose "ecosystem" feels more like a tundra. There's no Twitter or Facebook app.. The Kindle app is completely unusable. There's no image editing software. A People app is supposed to give you all the social media access you'd ever need, but It's impossible to write on someone's Facebook wall through the People app, Surface's social hub; the only workaround is to load Internet Explorer. The app selection, overall, is worse than the already pathetic Windows Phone app fare, looking like the software equivalent to a barren Soviet grocery store. You can do work, yes. But productivity is limited to a "preview" (beta) version of Microsoft Office. It also hurts that Office requires plunging into Windows RT's Desktop mode, where users of actual Windows 8 are able to install a decade's worth of legacy software. Normally, this would compensate. But RT users can't install any of this older software. None of it. Desktop mode is entirely worthless in RT, a cruel tease of non-functionality. Windows RT can't join a domain, be a Remote Desktop host, or boot from VHDs, for example. It also has a few omissions of its own. In particular, it lacks Windows Media Player and Windows Media Center. Windows RT can't run third-party desktop applications. At all. Office is the only desktop application allowed. The only third-party applications allowed on Surface will be Metro-style applications bought from the Windows Store. In this way, Microsoft made the problem I alluded to much worseâ€”developers can't even port their applications to run on ARM. This all puts Windows RT in a very awkward spot. Windows RT devices are beholden to the Windows Store, and while that may one day be fully populated, right now it isn't. While I think it's likely that developers will produce Windows Store apps, I don't know how quickly they will do so, or how well: Google Play, the Android store, is still substantially bereft of high quality tablet applications." It is truly Ironic, is it not? It sure is. THE IRONY of all Ironies, actually. That Microsoft -- the very name stands for SOFTWARE development -- has brought a new mobile device OS to market -- Windows RT -- that is critically crippled and likely fatally handicapped by a lack of -- SOFTWARE apps to run on it. And what does Microsoft do again? Did I mention? This is an amazing Irony of our times.

I believe that the only reason Windows RT exists is to fend-off future accusations of anti-trust and monopolistic practices against Win/Intel by the ARM camp. "Let 'em fail first, and they can't sue us later." Look, the Genuine Windows 8 devices will be a Huge success. Massively Huge. Why? Because they will be the first tablets to actually run the Hundreds of Millions of Genuine Windows x86 applications that have been written over the past quarter of a century. Applications that folks already own, use every day, and love. Windows RT for ARM has essentially zero functional apps. Nada. So Microsoft deliberately made two flavors of Windows 8. Genuine Windows 8 for x86 processors and Windows RT for ARM. They even deliberately gave the ARM's Windows RT a head-start in the market. Knowing full well that it would fail. And fail quickly. But the ARM camp can't be suing Win/Intel later for somehow being "precluded" from the market. Oh no no no. They were given a chance -- and lost fair and square. Too bad Jen's scheme to make a mobile x86 chip (Project Denver) failed, right boys?

Topic.Title: Break out the Purplesaurus Rex boys, she's up a penny.

Message.Msg: nvda_4_ever, You clearly have never actually used the Fed Wire system. 'Cause if you had, you would know that the max is $99,999,999.99 per wire. So for example, if you want to transfer $400 million -- as Best has done -- it requires five (5) Fed Wire system transfers. And with that knowledge, nvda_4_ever is not so dumb as before.

Message.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low
Message.Msg: Can someone point to 1 bad piece of news since nvidia has reported that has led to the stock losing 20% since beating earnings and raising guidance. I just don't get it...at this level the stock is already pricing in a bad miss on earnings. I realize that AMD and INTC didn't have amazing earnings but AMD is in a death spiral and Intel missed out on the mobile sales which hurt their consumer business. Nexus 7 is selling like hotcakes, people are waiting in line for the surface and its back ordered like 3 weeks already..they got the apple deal...they are in many more phones this quarter than last quarter. Aparently amazon ordered 10,000 tesla cards. This all adds up to a very strong quarter and even better guidance. Oh and lets not forget the entire kepler lineup ramping with TSMC 28nm finally almost meeting demand and increasing yields to over 80%. So can someone tell me anything bad. I just don't get it. I hope when they report, they announce some initiatives to give the investors confidence and stabilize the stock in the short term. There is no way we should be trading at half the value in cash...that's just ridiculous. Hopefully patience will be rewarded.
Please . . don't even bother posting . . bye bye.

Topic.Title: what are we missing? investor confidence is so low

Message.Msg: Agreed . . part of the problem is the attachment this stock has to funds and 'traders' that won't see this stock as anything but a short-term options opportunity. Until there is a clear signal to the funds and brokerage houses that it can have a long-term hold in in it's market(s), ie including the 4th quarter that appears to be slowdown to many, their won't be a consistent volume and demand for the shares until the next options cycle or ER itself. It is frustrating and I'm on of those long-term investors think it should be above $14 now based on the current estimates and even with a potential slowdown in the market priced in . .

Message.Title: MacHEADS !! = MEATheads
Message.Msg: Late night talk show hosts Conan O'Brien and Jimmy Kimmel recently poked fun at Apple fans for their brand loyalty. Apple fans have been called names like "Macheads" and "fanboys/girls" for their apparent willingness to purchase products made by the tech giant. O'Brien spoofed Apple's commercial by creating a song with the lyrics: "You will buy anything that we put into the store. No matter how minute how the changes are to the previous model." The jingle suggests that Apple fans will buy anything that the company creates.
